dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 185 RH: To designate the United States courthouse located at 101 East Pecan Street in Sherman, Texas, as the Paul Brown United States Courthouse.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Hall introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

Additional sponsors: Mr. Hinojosa, Mr. Sam Johnson of Texas, Ms. Granger, Mr. Poe of Texas, Mr. Burgess, Mr. Brady of Texas, Mr. Culberson, Mr. Smith of Texas, Mr. Cuellar, Mr. Doggett, Mr. Gohmert, Mr. Hensarling, Mr. Barton, Mr. Al Green of Texas, Mr. McCaul, Mr. Conaway, Mr. Thornberry, Mr. Weber of Texas, Mr. Flores, Mr. Neugebauer, Mr. Marchant, Mr. Williams, Mr. Farenthold, Mr. Gene Green of Texas, Ms. Eddie Bernice Johnson of Texas, Mr. Carter, Mr. Stockman, Mr. Olson, and Mr. Vela
Referred to the House Calendar and ordered to be printed

form.official-title: To designate the United States courthouse located at 101 East Pecan Street in Sherman, Texas, as the Paul Brown United States Courthouse.

section.text: The United States courthouse located at 101 East Pecan Street in Sherman, Texas, shall be known and designated as the Paul Brown United States Courthouse.

Any reference in a law, map, regulation, document, paper, or other record of the United States to the United States courthouse referred to in section 1 shall be deemed to be a reference to the Paul Brown United States Courthouse.

endorsement.action-desc: Referred to the House Calendar and ordered to be printed
